rows.name: Development Experience and Knowledge
cells: Some experience of SQL and stored procedures
At least 1 year of relevant development experience
At least 3 years of relevant development experience, data modeling and database design skills
At least 5 years of relevant development experience, data modeling and database design skills, and expert knowledge of at least one database platform
At least 7 years of relevant development experience, data modeling and database design skills, expert knowledge of at least one database platform, and ability to coach and train other developers

rows.name: Software Process Knowledge
cells: Not expected to have knowledge or experience of the software development processes
Expected to be able to follow a defined software development process
Expected to be able to follow and understand a defined software development process
Expected to be able to follow, understand, and enhance a defined software development process
Expected to be able to follow, understand, actively influence and enhance a defined software development process

rows.name: Design and Documentation Skills
cells: Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation
Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation; able to create documentation describing his/her code
Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation; able to create design and technical documentation including high-quality documentation of his/her code

Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation; able to create high-quality design and technical documentation including documentation of his/her code; able to write high-quality use cases and audit documentation

Able to read and understand project and requirement documentation; able to create high-quality design and technical documentation including documentation of his/her code; able to write high-quality use cases and audit documentation

rows.name: Job Titles
cells:
Junior DB Developer

Junior DBA

DB Developer

DBA

Senior DB Developer

Senior DBA

Lead DB Developer

Lead DBA

Chief DB Developer

Chief DBA

rows.name: Roles Played on a Project
cells: Plays the Developer role
Plays the Developer role
Plays the role of a Key Developer and a Designer or a Team Lead of 2-5 engineers
Plays the Key Developer and Designer roles, and usually also performs a Team Lead, Architect, Reviewer or Auditor role.
Can play any role, typically a senior position. Responsibilities can include Team Lead, Architect, Reviewer, Auditor, Technical Trainer, and Process Engineer.

rows.name: Reliability
cells: Expected to work effectively under supervision
Expected to implement functionality without direct supervision
Expected to be self-managing, implement functionality without supervision and test his/her work thoroughly using test cases
Expected to be self-managing, take technical responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision and test his/her work thoroughly using test cases
Expected to be self-managing, take technical responsibility for a subsystem or a whole project, work without supervision and test his/her work thoroughly using test cases

rows.name: Quality
cells: No specific expectations regarding quality
Must show a sense of responsibility for the quality of the deliverables created by him/her
Creates deliverables in good quality
Must be a role model for colleagues; creates deliverables in high quality
Must be a role model for colleagues, on a par with the best industry standards; creates deliverables in excellent quality

rows.name: Customer Relations
cells: Not expected to deal directly with customers
Not expected to deal directly with customers
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; visit customers with supervision
Expected to participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

Expected to be on a par with the best industry experts in customer relationship skills; participate in phone conferences; be interviewed by customers; be involved in customer workshops and presentations; visit customers without supervision

rows.name: Language Level in the Customer's Communication Language
cells: Able to read and understand the Customer's Communication Language
Able to read and write the Customer's Communication Language and have some speaking ability
Comfortably able to read, write and speak the Customer's Communication Language
Comfortably able to read, write and speak the Customer's Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
Totally fluent in the spoken and written variants of the Customer's Communication Language; able to write high-quality unambiguous texts
